refsect2.title: soup_socket_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new (disconnected) socket

listitem.simpara: name of first property to set (or NULL)
value of optname1, followed by additional property/value pairs

refsect2.title: soup_socket_connect ()
refsect2.para: If SOUP_SOCKET_FLAG_NONBLOCKING has been set on the socket, this begins asynchronously connecting to the given address. The socket will emit connect_result when it succeeds or fails (but not before returning from this function).
If SOUP_SOCKET_FLAG_NONBLOCKING has not been set, this will attempt to synchronously connect.

listitem.simpara: a client SoupSocket (which must not already be connected)
SOUP_STATUS_CONTINUE if connecting asynchronously, otherwise a success or failure code.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_listen ()
refsect2.para: Makes sock start listening on the given interface and port. When connections come in, sock will emit new_connection.

listitem.simpara: a server SoupSocket (which must not already be connected or listening)
whether or not sock is now listening.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_start_ssl ()
refsect2.para: Starts using SSL on socket.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_start_proxy_ssl ()
refsect2.para: Starts using SSL on socket, expecting to find a host named ssl_host.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_disconnect ()
refsect2.para: Disconnects sock. Any further read or write attempts on it will fail.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_is_connected ()
refsect2.para: Tests if sock is connected to another host

refsect2.title: SoupSocketCallback ()
refsect2.para: The callback function passed to soup_socket_client_new_async().

listitem.simpara: an HTTP status code indicating success or failure

refsect2.title: SoupSocketListenerCallback ()
refsect2.para: The callback function passed to soup_socket_server_new(), which receives new connections.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_client_new_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: SoupSocket* soup_socket_client_new_async (const char *hostname, guint port, gpointer ssl_creds, SoupSocketCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Creates a connection to hostname and port. callback will be called when the connection completes (or fails).
Uses the default GMainContext. If you need to use an alternate context, use soup_socket_new() and soup_socket_connect() directly.

listitem.simpara: SSL credentials structure, or NULL if not SSL
callback to call when the socket is connected
the new socket (not yet ready for use).

refsect2.title: soup_socket_client_new_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: SoupSocket* soup_socket_client_new_sync (const char *hostname, guint port, gpointer ssl_creds, guint *status_ret);
refsect2.para: Creates a connection to hostname and port. If status_ret is not NULL, it will contain a status code on return.

listitem.simpara: SSL credentials structure, or NULL if not SSL
pointer to return the soup status in
the new socket, or NULL if it could not connect.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_server_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: SoupSocket* soup_socket_server_new (SoupAddress *local_addr, gpointer ssl_creds, SoupSocketListenerCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Create and open a new SoupSocket listening on the specified address. callback will be called each time a client connects, with a new SoupSocket.
Uses the default GMainContext. If you need to use an alternate context, use soup_socket_new() and soup_socket_listen() directly.

listitem.simpara: Local address to bind to. (Use soup_address_any_new() to accept connections on any local address)
SSL credentials, or NULL if this is not an SSL server
Callback to call when a client connects
a new SoupSocket, or NULL if there was a failure.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_get_local_address ()
refsect2.para: Returns the SoupAddress corresponding to the local end of sock.

refsect2.title: soup_socket_get_remote_address ()
refsect2.para: Returns the SoupAddress corresponding to the remote end of sock.

refsect2.title: enum SoupSocketIOStatus
refsect2.para: Return value from the SoupSocket IO methods.

listitem.simpara: Cannot read/write any more at this time

refsect2.title: soup_socket_read ()
refsect2.programlisting: SoupSocketIOStatus soup_socket_read (SoupSocket *sock, gpointer buffer, gsize len, gsize *nread);
refsect2.para: Attempts to read up to len bytes from sock into buffer. If some data is successfully read, soup_socket_read() will return SOUP_SOCKET_OK, and *nread will contain the number of bytes actually read.

If sock is non-blocking, and no data is available, the return value will be SOUP_SOCKET_WOULD_BLOCK. In this case, the caller can connect to the readable signal to know when there is more data to read. (NB: You MUST read all available data off the socket first. The readable signal will only be emitted after soup_socket_read() has returned SOUP_SOCKET_WOULD_BLOCK.)

listitem.simpara: on return, the number of bytes read into buffer
a SoupSocketIOStatus, as described above (or SOUP_SOCKET_EOF if the socket is no longer connected, or SOUP_SOCKET_ERROR on any other error).

refsect2.title: soup_socket_read_until ()
refsect2.programlisting: SoupSocketIOStatus soup_socket_read_until (SoupSocket *sock, gpointer buffer, gsize len, gconstpointer boundary, gsize boundary_len, gsize *nread, gboolean *got_boundary);
refsect2.para: Like soup_socket_read(), but reads no further than the first occurrence of boundary. (If the boundary is found, it will be included in the returned data, and *got_boundary will be set to TRUE.) Any data after the boundary will returned in future reads.

listitem.simpara: on return, the number of bytes read into buffer
on return, whether or not the data in buffer ends with the boundary string

refsect2.title: soup_socket_write ()
refsect2.programlisting: SoupSocketIOStatus soup_socket_write (SoupSocket *sock, gconstpointer buffer, gsize len, gsize *nwrote);
refsect2.para: Attempts to write len bytes from buffer to sock. If some data is successfully written, the resturn status will be SOUP_SOCKET_SUCCESS, and *nwrote will contain the number of bytes actually written.

If sock is non-blocking, and no data could be written right away, the return value will be SOUP_SOCKET_WOULD_BLOCK. In this case, the caller can connect to the writable signal to know when more data can be written. (NB: writable is only emitted after a SOUP_SOCKET_WOULD_BLOCK.)

listitem.simpara: on return, number of bytes written
a SoupSocketIOStatus, as described above (or SOUP_SOCKET_EOF or SOUP_SOCKET_ERROR).

refsect2.title: SOUP_SOCKET_FLAG_REUSEADDR
refsect2.para: An alias for the "reuseaddr" property.

refsect2.title: SOUP_SOCKET_FLAG_CLOEXEC
refsect2.para: An alias for the "cloexec" property.

refsect2.title: SOUP_SOCKET_TIMEOUT
refsect2.para: An alias for the "timeout" property.

refsect2.title: SOUP_SOCKET_IS_SERVER

refsect2.title: The "async-context" property
refsect2.para: The GMainContext to dispatch this socket's async I/O in.

refsect2.title: The "cloexec" property
refsect2.para: Whether or not the socket will be closed automatically on exec().
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "is-server" property
refsect2.para: Whether or not the socket is a server socket.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "nodelay" property
refsect2.para: Whether or not the socket uses TCP NODELAY.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "non-blocking" property
refsect2.para: Whether or not the socket uses non-blocking I/O.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "reuseaddr" property
refsect2.para: Whether or not the socket uses the TCP REUSEADDR flag.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "ssl-creds" property
refsect2.para: SSL credential information, passed from the session to the SSL implementation.

refsect2.title: The "timeout" property
refsect2.para: Value in seconds to timeout a blocking I/O.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "connect-result" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SoupSocket *sock, gint status, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when a connection attempt succeeds or fails. This is used internally by soup_socket_client_new_async().

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "disconnected" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SoupSocket *sock, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when the socket is disconnected, for whatever reason.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "new-connection" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SoupSocket *sock, SoupSocket *new, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when a listening socket (set up with soup_socket_listen() or soup_socket_server_new()) receives a new connection.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "readable" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SoupSocket *sock, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when an async socket is readable. See soup_socket_read() and soup_socket_read_until().

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "writable" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SoupSocket *sock, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when an async socket is writable. See soup_socket_write().

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
